alert.note: Alert for Pine (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 17 at 4:06PM CDT until August 17 at 7:15PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: The National Weather Service in Duluth has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Pine County in east central Minnesota... * Until 715 PM CDT. * At 406 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Pine City, Rock Creek, Brook Park, Henriette, West Rock, Beroun, Greely and Chengwatana State Forest. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
